alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 21 at 2:41AM PST until December 21 at 3:45AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN VENTURA COUNTY... At 241 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated torrential rain and isolated thunderstorms across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall rates of over 2 inches in one half hour and 3.10 inches in one hour were reported in Oxnard. While rain has decreased in intensity somewhat, rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour were still occurring, and additional rainfall of 1 to 2.5 inches is expected in portions of the warned area. This will cause significant and life-threatening flooding of roadways through the early morning hours. Flash flooding will continue through at least 345 AM PST. Rocks and boulders may fall onto roadways in steep terrain. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oxnard, Ventura, Camarillo, Ojai, Santa Paula, Ventura Harbor, Meiners Oaks, Lake Casitas, El Rio, Solimar Beach and Highway 33 between Wheeler Springs and Rose Valley Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
